meanings.sent1: She redipped the paintbrush into the water to clean it.
meanings.sent2: After the chocolate had hardened, she redipped the strawberries for a second coat.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally redipped his cookie in the coffee, making it extra soggy.
meanings.sent4: The artist redipped the brush into the vibrant blue paint, adding depth to the ocean scene.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully redipped the truffle into the melted chocolate, ensuring a perfect coating.

meanings.definition: To immerse (something) in a liquid again.
meanings.sent1: The fabric faded, so she redipped it in the dye to restore its color.
meanings.sent2: He redipped the cookie in the milk to soften it before eating.
meanings.sent3: The explorer redipped his toe into the icy water, feeling the chill once more.
meanings.sent4: She redipped the candle wick in the wax, ensuring a steady flame.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler redipped the gold ring in the solution to restore its shine.
